channel.title: Poems on jacob fisher poetry
channel.description: Recent content in Poems on jacob fisher poetry

item.title: Love stubs
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: ~Centre~ Train from Canterbury. 27 September 2021. Wolf Alice’s Don’t Delete the Kisses. ~/Centre~ Departing first my train. Then my tears. And I was building a palimpsest of mistakes. The palimpsest was my opacifying barrier Without reflection. Everybody tells me I was right; The voices can still be heard. Quiet, pathetic sobber. Against the steady kick and a Blur of nature. By degrees In Nothing I felt eveything. But you were Endangering a boy—and I you.

item.title: Ward Ends, Otherwise the White Ward
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)

item.title: soul scales
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: when you were here before, things were different. but now that you’re gone I learnt myself. although I lost you, my soul and the importance of you placed oppositely on those old-fashioned scales: gravity doesn’t decide for me. so self-centred is it, she, he, they (whoever the fuck YOU are) that my soul’s weight fluctuates to my heart’s desire.

item.title: EMBERS AND ENDING EMBRACES
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: A dark light now unnights my soul. A bare interior within Where grey walls now entrap me in Blinding depression. Yet I see No windows, no doors; I had screamed, Stuck in stagnation; sinister Past. Why can’t it be more peaceful? And future feels funeral for Ever. You both could make my presents Playful. My gaiety should Not be culpable, but from the Gallery. ‘Encore!’ it’s justice Ruled my prosecution, upon Whom I have so much relied so Inexorably, tightening Nooses.

item.title: I lived by the chalice
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: Fresh poison for sale, buy now Before someone you know can. No, we don’t do executions here; We’re a friendly business. Try your Other friends. They’re nice.

item.title: Flicker
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: TVs flickering in the street, and Strobing the docile faces, and Pulsing the pleasures of another people. Biharmonic stereo, play. This mono thinking delay Pushes us into dismay; Ultimately the stereo stray. Boring books burning bright: Soot makes you stutter. Darkness now hidden behind The anthracite cloak. Please don’t let the salamander get me… Listen, and listen well. Seeming specious, how alien it seems! Chanting chords: now a diminished art. Say what you came to say, and go!

item.title: Cabs at Christmas
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: The taxi driver desolately peers With beautiful blues blaring in his cab. His cheeks becoming stained and daubed with tears. Awaiting blithely that next drunken drab. His sharpened scalpel, recently stolen, Now covets blood once more on Christmas eve. ‘Crime pays the dime on time,’ he chants his omen. Snowy teardrops always join begs of leave. This sweet piano dampens heavy souls Because the midnight sun will never set. ‘Baby, baby, don’t you know these rolling roads Make the midnight monster in me?

item.title: The Society
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)

item.title: Metaphysical me
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: Not stupidity. Not intelligence. Not individuality. Not humanity. Watch Death larking, 'Cause he always loved it— And you can see it in his eyes. I run to him; I can't see; I feel; I-I! What’s the last sentiment? Why so hesitant? It’s only me. Crazed, yet resident desperation.

item.title: Hangman
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: Hang the man, Guess the letter. Fuck the man with Your incessant stupidity. Game of young; Gamble of life. Why do you summon Me to your tall Towers of bloodied Execution? Vowel, two consonants, and another beam. The noose tightens As the pens strokes. DEATH IS FREEDOM

item.title: "Friendship"
item.author: jacob@jcbfshr.com (Jacob Fisher)
item.description: The third rule is broke And our cathedral bursts. Fracture the walls But not our spirit.
